subject.name: Engineering Chemistry
subject.description: This course introduces fundamental chemical principles and their applications in engineering, covering atomic and molecular structure, spectroscopy, electrochemistry, water chemistry, polymers, and organic synthesis.
objectives: Understand the structure and behavior of atoms and molecules using modern chemical theories.
Gain insight into spectroscopic techniques and their engineering applications.
Develop understanding of electrochemical principles, corrosion, and fuels.
Learn methods for water treatment and prevention of industrial boiler issues.
Understand polymer chemistry and the classification of plastics based on properties and applications.
Study key organic reactions and drug synthesis processes.

units.title: Atomic and Molecular Structure
topics: Electromagnetic radiations and dual nature of electron
Heisenberg uncertainty principle and photoelectric effect
Planck’s theory and atomic orbitals combination
Molecular orbital theory and Bent’s rule
VSEPR theory with examples
Coordination numbers and geometries
Isomerism in transition metal compounds
Metal carbonyls: synthesis and structure

units.title: Spectroscopy
topics: Principles of rotational and vibrational spectroscopy
Selection rules and applications in diatomic molecules
Introduction to electronic spectroscopy and UV-VIS spectroscopy
Principle and applications of Nuclear Magnetic Resonance (NMR) spectroscopy

units.title: Electrochemistry and Fuels
topics: Nernst equation, EMF, and electrochemical cells
Introduction to corrosion: mechanisms and types
Waterline corrosion, stress and pitting corrosion
Lead-acid and Leclanche cells
Calorific value and analysis of fuels (proximate and ultimate)
Fuel cells and biofuels

units.title: Water Chemistry
topics: Hardness of water and its estimation (EDTA and Alkalinity methods)
Water softening techniques: soda lime, zeolite, ion exchange
Boiler problems: sludge, scale formation, priming, and foaming
Boiler corrosion and caustic embrittlement

units.title: Polymers and Plastics
topics: Polymerization techniques: free radical, ionic, and coordination mechanisms
Preparation and properties of phenol-formaldehyde resins, elastomers, and synthetic rubbers (Buna-S, Buna-N, neoprene)
Inorganic polymers and silicones
Adhesives and epoxy resins
Thermoplastics vs thermosetting plastics
Commercially important plastics: polyethylene, PVC, polystyrene

units.title: Organic Reactions and Drug Synthesis
topics: Introduction to intermediates and reaction types: substitution, addition, elimination, oxidation, and reduction
Diels–Alder cyclization and epoxide ring-opening reactions
Synthesis of commonly used drug molecules such as aspirin

suggested_books: Chemistry: Principles and Applications, M.J. Sienko and R.A. Plane, McGraw Hill International
Fundamentals of Molecular Spectroscopy, C.N. Banwell, McGraw Hill International
Engineering Chemistry (NPTEL Web-Book), B.L. Tembe, Kamaluddin, and M.S. Krishnan, NPTEL
Physical Chemistry, P.W. Atkins, Oxford University Press
A Textbook of Engineering Chemistry, S. Chawla, Dhanpat Rai Publications
